The surf.session Module¶

class surf.session.Session(default_store=None, mapping={}, auto_persist=False, auto_load=False, use_cached=False, cache_expire=3600)¶

the session will manage the rest of the components in surf, it also acts as the type factory for surf, the resources will walk the graph in a lazy manner based on the session that they are bound to (the last created session)

close()¶
good practice to close the session when no longer needed, remember, all resources will lose the ability to reference the session thus the store and the mapping
load_resource(uri, subject, store=None, data=None, file=None, location=None, format=None, *classes)¶
creates a Python instance of the class specified by uri, and sets the intenal properties according to the ones by the specified source
map_instance(uri, subject, store=None, classes=[], block_outo_load=False)¶
creates a Python instance of the class specified by uri and classes to be inherited, see map_type for more information
map_type(uri, store=None, *classes)¶
creates a Python class based on the uri given, also will add the classes to the inheritance list
